availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton J. Miller (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant. Married to Mary M. Smith Miller. Father of Mason C. Miller, Alfred S. Miller, Martha F. Miller, Sarah Miller, and Harry Miller. Clerk in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Rockcastle County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Rockcastle County in 1860. Merchant in Rockcastle County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District, p. 184A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, p. 584.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 204A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, p. 34A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Rockcastle County, KY, June 1863, p. 243.
"Miller," Mount Vernon Signal (Mount Vernon, KY), May 3, 1907, p. 3.
"Milton Jefferson Miller (1827-1907)," Find A Grave, Memorial 6123823, accessed September 22, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6123823.
